description: Typo? No, they just last forever like they are taking a long slumber.. Zzzz...
Actually a succulent rather than a palm!
Indirect but bright light. Ideal for corners next to windows!

The maidenhair is more fragile than most ferns. Avoid touching the fronds to prevent withering. Keep the soil constantly moist or place in a humid area. Maidenhairs can survive in low light but should be placed in medium to indirect bright light if you want more growth!
Bright and indirect light for these to thrive!
If grown indoors, place these flowers near a bright spot. If they are outdoors, place them in indirect sun.
